## Algorithm Simplified

An algorithm is a set of instructions to solve a problem or perform a task. Think of it as a recipe: it has clear steps to follow, using specific ingredients (input) to create a dish (output). Algorithms can be simple, like adding two numbers, or complex, like finding the shortest route on a map.

Some algorithms use "if/then" statements (conditionals) to make decisions, like a choose-your-own-adventure book. Others might use guesswork (randomized algorithms) when an exact answer is hard to find.
